title: What am I supposed to do.... Happens in the majority of my games :(
body:
So its not just one player intent feeding now, it's the WHOLE team now and its pretty sad for those who are trying to climb with these intent feeders  since it makes the chance at winning the game ZERO and the whole chat is just full of "Please report !@$!@$#!@" and toxic language. Is the player report working? I'm not getting any report feed backs from the report i have sent out recently. And I have noticed that I have been paired up with players with roughly 200 wins in norms which doesn't help where as I have 800 wins in norms. Does the rank match up goes by ranked wins? norm wins? or random? 

Oh and im looking for a player to duo boost me, Thank you :)

replies.body:
Statistically speaking, if you aren't toxic or a troll that's 4/5 people on your team that can and 5/5 on the enemy so it should happen to the enemy more than you even if you do not realise it. The trolls in that game are just super unlucky for you to have but learning how to deal with them, focus on yourself and learn is by far the best thing you can take out of it. When I smurf, I can win games 4v5 with int feeders on my team. If you try to learn enough you can get to that too.

The ranked reporting thing is really weird, sometimes mine seem to go through, sometimes they don't. Weird af.

And with the ranked thing, I don't really know what you mean by that but you will verse people the same mmr as you. For instance, if you're in bronze 3 you will verse people who are around your division unless they have high or low mmr for their division e.g Silver V playing with you because of low mmr (too many recent losses).

As a side note, asking for someone to duo boost you on the official board where Riot roams frequently is quite risky xd

> [{quoted}](name=Yukuu,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=PbJ5Pf8K,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2016-12-22T02:32:25.627+0000)
>
> Statistically speaking, if you aren't toxic or a troll that's 4/5 people on your team that can and 5/5 on the enemy so it should happen to the enemy more than you even if you do not realise it. 

This is just badly oversimplified math, and really needs to stop being posted again and again.


Your so called statistic will be true for a group of players, lets call them "B"
however with millions of league players there's also a very sizable group
"A" and "C"

A's get lucky. They have even less than the average 45% of trolls on their team, they have 26% of 
trolls they encounter being on their team.

C's, well C's get screwed, they are the guy on the other team to the A's, the one who's
not trolling, but in 74% of their game the troll ends up being on their team.

The problem is these are real groups of millions of real people.
So posting oversimplified bad math and saying its not a problem
is just straight shitpost imho.

I can understand that considering there are millions of players but where the problem occurs in that reasoning is that that's a VERY diminutive % of players who will encounter such bad luck. You can have 1% crit in your runes but the chances of you critting 2 times in a row with them are almost non-existent. You also need to factor that these people will play hundreds of games this season so is should start to even out over time and if they are THAT unlucky in that minuscule % there are ways to prevent it, like duo queuing with people to make it 3/5 and 5/5.

It's not oversimplified bad maths, it's quite subjective with a lot of "what ifs" so calling it a shitpost is quite ignorant. No matter what way you look at it it's not a "problem" like you say. My first 3 games this season I had trolls or afks. As I'm now on 100 games+ they have slowly started to even out to a reasonable %

> [{quoted}](name=Yukuu,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=PbJ5Pf8K,comment-id=000300000000,timestamp=2016-12-22T03:42:58.442+0000)
>
> I can understand that considering there are millions of players but where the problem occurs in that reasoning is that that's a VERY diminutive % of players who will encounter such bad luck. You can have 1% crit in your runes but the chances of you critting 2 times in a row with them are almost non-existent. You also need to factor that these people will play hundreds of games this season so is should start to even out over time and if they are THAT unlucky in that minuscule % there are ways to prevent it, like duo queuing with people to make it 3/5 and 5/5.
> 
> It's not oversimplified bad maths, it's quite subjective with a lot of "what ifs" so calling it a shitpost is quite ignorant. No matter what way you look at it it's not a "problem" like you say. My first 3 games this season I had trolls or afks. As I'm now on 100 games+ they have slowly started to even out to a reasonable %


"It might be reasonable that it will even out for the community as a whole, it is NOT reasonable to say it will even out for an individual.

You can't reasonably use the individual's perspective of having a better chance of the enemy having a troll but then use the communities perspective of large numbers to say it's ok."


Nobody cares that you have played 100+ games already, your not average.
100 million accounts, the post I read was 2.9% would get more than half after 100 games
so thats 2.9 million players.

So "its not a problem" is wrong. I dont even care which team the troll or feeder is on
having them on the enemy team isnt good or healthy for the game.

Duo queue is not a solution, the other team will have a duo which reduces the chances
evenly for both teams. Hell why dont you say just have pre-made 5's.
Tada I've solved it. No, people want to and do play solo.

The solution is for riot to DO SOMETHING.. woooo i said it.
You shouldn't have to play for hundreds of hours to have
got just the "average" number of trolls.

Posts that say "its not a problem" and try to justify it with random snippets of numbers 
are shitposts in my opinion.

Obviously it's not good or healthy, I wish there were none but there are a plethora of reasons why trolls/afk's etc do what they do and it's something that a gaming company doesn't have much control over since it's the individual player and how they feel IRL. You ban them the first time they do it and you will have little-no players playing your game. People have bad days and play the game for a lot of different reasons so one day almost everyone will troll/afk. There's no good solution that Riot can implement that can fix the issue without banning it's entire player base.

Every single person I have ever talked to about this issue has trolled or afk'd on multiple occasions whether it's intentional or not. What's your solution, ban them? Give them leaver buster which after it's finished, nobody cares about.

Trolls, ragers and afkers are apart of every intensive game/moba. There is no easy way to fixing it. To fix the problem, you need to fix the people behind it and the sheer number of people who do it at least once in their time playing this game is gargantuan. 

Complaining about the issue without any real ways to fix it is complaining to the sky, it doesn't do anything. The company is aware and they do try to help fix and think of ideas to fix it but there is seemingly no good way in LoL to fix this. 

If you are so passionate and argumentative about this issue, post on boards on how to solve it and Riot will see it, otherwise you need to just deal with it and hope you're not unlucky.

> [{quoted}](name=Yukuu,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=PbJ5Pf8K,comment-id=00030000000000000000,timestamp=2016-12-22T08:31:04.525+0000)
>
> Obviously it's not good or healthy, I wish there were none but there are a plethora of reasons why trolls/afk's etc do what they do and it's something that a gaming company doesn't have much control over since it's the individual player and how they feel IRL. You ban them the first time they do it and you will have little-no players playing your game. People have bad days and play the game for a lot of different reasons so one day almost everyone will troll/afk. There's no good solution that Riot can implement that can fix the issue without banning it's entire player base.
> 

Disagree completely, also they aren't trying.


> Every single person I have ever talked to about this issue has trolled or afk'd on multiple occasions whether it's intentional or not. What's your solution, ban them? Give them leaver buster which after it's finished, nobody cares about.
> 

Yep, put something in place to aggressively ban the trolls, and watch people stop doing it real quick.
while your at it and give us much earlier surrender so we arn't held hostage for 20 mins.


> Trolls, ragers and afkers are apart of every intensive game/moba. There is no easy way to fixing it. To fix the problem, you need to fix the people behind it and the sheer number of people who do it at least once in their time playing this game is gargantuan. 
> 

Its not the one offs that are a big problem. Go look at the threads posting match histories of
people trolling consistently and not gettting caught till they are; posted on the boards
or after - literally runing a hundred+ games


> Complaining about the issue without any real ways to fix it is complaining to the sky, it doesn't do anything. The company is aware and they do try to help fix and think of ideas to fix it but there is seemingly no good way in LoL to fix this. 
> 

Well make your mind up, first you said they have no control, then that there's no good solution, and now
that they are trying.

Show me anything riots done about trolls, they've been sitting on their hands doing nothing 
for years. Oh wait, we have a naughty word filter, huzzah!


> If you are so passionate and argumentative about this issue, post on boards on how to solve it and Riot will see it, otherwise you need to just deal with it and hope you're not unlucky.

Acutally yeah, Im on the boards, and I call out any time I see people
trying to give riot a free pass, eg "it evens out", "everyone does it", "its hard"

Bullshit. They are a billion dollar company, they've done a lot of studies on how
bad this is, how it makes people toxic, how it lowers win rates by 25%

What have they done about trolls since removing tribunal two years ago?

NOTHING.

If you aggressively ban trolls/flamers/afker's etc there are some that will stop being a knob just because they feel like it which is good, but the majority of trolls and the like do it because they've had a lot of bad recent games, a bad day or playing to try to forget about things/life and are just pretty tilted. Not many people have the ability to control their actions when they're feeling emotional and it can quite easily consume people especially if on top of everything going on, you're getting camped or whatever. When people get to the state of rage quitting in frustration or flaming their team, they don't care that there is punishment. Practically everyone has games where they r/q or flame hard or whatever because of the emotions flowing through them from a variety of possible things, to ban everyone who has shit like that happen as I said is banning most of the playerbase. 

Riot wants LoL to be an eSport with a large audience and player base. To ban most of your playerbase for tilting in 1/2 games is a stupid idea and that's why in your eyes, they haven't done anything. They can either try to find other ways of dealing with tilted players and until then leave it how it is now, or aggressively ban people and I know how much this issue has been splattered EVERYWHERE for the longest time and it's quite obvious they feel there are way more negatives than positives that come with the aggressive banning as they haven't done it. They know about this issue, they know their options and they don't think aggressively banning is the way they want THEIR game to go. 

You know they play this game too right? Do you know the saga between Phreak and Tyler1? They've dealt with trolls/int feeders before and they know that it's not fun and not to sound redundant but with the amount of yelling the community has given to them about trolls they know this issue far too well already.

ill duo up on flex? 
if you want

> [{quoted}](name=Waterboy141,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=PbJ5Pf8K,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2016-12-22T01:38:34.653+0000)
>
> ill duo up on flex? 
> if you want

add me if you want

Well lets see here.

The Draven's account probably inted into bronze and has just played their when they feel like playing given a quick look at op.gg (he has also been inting for 5 hours straight)

Yasuo only int's when he feels like it, so won't be banned most likely (he plays normally most games.)

And Olaf is the same case as Yasuo, so again won't be banned most likely.

The only one likely to be banned is draven, and even then, he still hasn't been banned after 6 straight games of intent feeding, so that gives you an idea of the systems riot has in place to stop intent feeding.

I'll break down your other comments first before getting into your main topic.

>I'm not getting any report feed backs

Just because you aren't receiving report feedback notifications doesn't mean players you reported aren't being punished. No feedback does not equal no ban. Feedback is one of the biggest failings of the instant feedback system, because the notification only pops up for a very limited number of players in very limited circumstances.

The tl;dr of that mess is that the majority of players who report someone who is then punished will not see the feedback notification.

> I have been paired up with players with roughly 200 wins in norms

Wins does not equal skill. Some players learn much faster or slower than average. Some players have a mentality better or worse suited to the skillset of the game. Some players take a lot more or less in form a single game than average. Wins is only an average representation of skill for those who are average in every single attribute, which is a very small percentage of players, so wins doesn't really tell you all that much.

That is also ignoring the presence of smurf accounts, where someone might be trying a new role or the like, and may very well have double your normal wins on their main.

tl;dr Wins means very little as far as skill is concerned.

> Does the rank match up goes by ranked wins? norm wins? or random?

Ranked and Normal MMR (Matchmaking Rating) are separate. Ranked wins increase your ranked MMR and Normal wins increase your normal MMR. Every different queue has it's own MMR.

> Oh and im looking for a player to duo boost me, Thank you :)

No bueno.
___
Onto your main point "Happens in the majority of my games".

First off I'd like to introduce you to a friend I call [Negativity Bias](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Negativity_bias). 
> The negativity bias, also known as the negativity effect, refers to the notion that, even when of equal intensity, things of a more negative nature ... have a greater effect on one's psychological state and processes than do neutral or positive things. In other words, something very positive will generally have less of an impact ... than something equally emotional but negative. The negativity bias has been investigated within many different domains, including the _**formation of impressions**_ ... and memory...

Don't get me wrong. It sucks to encounter behaviour like this, especially in such saturation, but it's hardly in the majority of your games. I would recommend challenging yourself after each game, to note down each champion in the game and mark them with +, ~ or - for positive, neutral and negative. It would offer you some very valuable perspective on just how many players you encounter are actually negative compared to those that are neutral or positive.

In your last 20 games (normal, flex, solo/duo) there were 7 players I was unsure of, 70 that were neutral and 3 that were intent feeding. All three of those intent feeding players came from the one game you screenshotted above. Sure that game sucked, but it's hardly the norm for your games. Quite the opposite in fact. Even if you assume all 7 of those vaguely sus players were intent feeders, 10/80 is not the majority. Not even close.

(Obviously I can't see all kinds of toxicity from just match history so this only applies to intent feeding)

I've had times when it really feels like most players I encounter are toxic asshats, but when I actually look back and think about it, it's usually just a few that have soured my experience, and that perspective helps me to get over it and move on to just enjoy another game.
You will probably get a warning you should not have names in your post. And if you want this to go further i suggest submitting a ticket to Riot.
